meanings.definition: Insulting or abusive language used to express blame or censure.
meanings.sent1: The bully hurled invective at his classmates during recess.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech was filled with invective towards his opponents.
meanings.sent3: The parrot surprised everyone by mimicking the invective used by the angry neighbor.
meanings.sent4: The invective in the argument was like a storm of harsh words.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the impact of invective on relationships.

meanings.sent1: The invective remarks left a lasting impact on the audience.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his invective behavior towards others.
meanings.sent3: The invective tone of the movie made it difficult to watch.
meanings.sent4: His invective attitude towards teamwork hindered progress.
meanings.sent5: The invective nature of the comments made everyone uncomfortable.
